edu.lafayette.bci.sigproc

Class Power

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.lafayette.bci.sigproc.Algorithm
      • edu.lafayette.bci.sigproc.Power

  • public class Power
extends Algorithm
    Calculates an approximate value for the average power measured over time of the incoming signal. The signal must be periodic with a period equal to that specified in the constructor.
    Author:
    Haley Garrison

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Power(double period, double sampleRate)
      Creates a new power algorithm with the given period over which to average.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Point process(Point p)
      Processes a single point and returns a single point.

        addTap

    • Constructor Detail

      • Power

        public Power(double period,
     double sampleRate)
        Creates a new power algorithm with the given period over which to average. The sample rate determines how many samples exist per period.
        Parameters:
        period - The period of the input signal in secs
        sampleRate - The sample rate of the signal in secs

    • Method Detail

      • process

        public Point process(Point p)
        Processes a single point and returns a single point. This method calculates the discrete power of the signal.
        Specified by:
        process in class Algorithm
        Parameters:
        p - The point to be processed
        Returns:
        The processed point
